data.text: @dgurdasani1 The reduction in "mood" for covid patients seems worrying, suggestive of something not quite right.

Maybe the condition should be "loss of smell/taste" or "3 or more other symptoms".

@DarrenKilgarif1 @dgurdasani1 They aren’t discussing Medicine. They’re discussing stats. In studies that agree with their narrative.

If they were discussing medicine they’d be discussing what causes the symptoms and how to make children better as well. They don’t.

@VictorialHand @dgurdasani1 To be honest it's almost irrelevant to him whether it's linked to Covid or not. He's not yet at threshold that he would get to go to LC centre (might next time though) but GPs have got to wise up to fact many kida are now presenting with regular symptoms that didn't have before.
@melissacreate15 @dgurdasani1 Yes - my daughter too - but it won’t be linked  to Covid so that appears in these figures.

@melissacreate15 that sounds very frustrating- I'm sorry to hear that. This study is based on questionnaires sent to households, so not dependent on healthcare reporting, so hopefully does not suffer from that particular bias.

@dgurdasani1 But this must be tip of ice berg? My sons had issues since mid November when had Covid for second time. But we have had no diagnosis. No blood tests and no physical examination. Phone consultations only. So his issues won't appear on this chart.
